translated: Holm, Stig Johannes, MD, practicing ophthalmologist, Gothenburg, born May 20, 1902 in Svalöv, Malmöhus County, eldest son of the Rev. Albin H. and Olga Rosenius. Married in 1931 to Emma Trollberg, who holds a degree in theology. Children: Ödde (born 1932), Cecilia (born 1937, died 1946), and Mårten (born 1939). Holm graduated from high school in Gothenburg in 1920, received his medical license in Lund in 1932, and his doctorate in medicine there in 1938. He served as a docent in ophthalmology at Lund University from 1941 to 1944. His medical experience includes serving as a medical assistant in the surgical department of Sahlgrenska Hospital in Gothenburg for eight months beginning in 1932, a temporary physician at the ear clinic in Lund for four months in 1933, and a medical practitioner at the Lambaréné hospital in French Equatorial Africa from 1933 to 1935 under renowned physician and philosopher Albert Schweitzer. From 1937 to 1942, he was an assistant physician, senior assistant physician, and acting head physician at the ophthalmology clinic in Lund. Later, from 1942 to 1944, he was assistant physician and acting senior physician in the ophthalmology department at the Sahlgrenska Hospital. Holm was also a physician in the second ambulance unit in Northern Finland in 1940. He was a practicing ophthalmologist in Gothenburg and a consultant ophthalmologist at Varberg Hospital. Holm was an active member of various medical organizations, including serving as chairman of the Lund Local Committee for Exiled Persons from 1935 to 1942, and a member of the Swedish Junior Doctors Association, where he was an advocate for members in Malmöhus County from 1937 to 1942. Holm published multiple works on ophthalmological topics, including his doctoral thesis "The Status of Ocular Refraction among the Pallénegrides of Gabon" in 1937, and "Macular Proliferation (Pseudotumor) and Similar Morbid Pictures" in 1941, as well as several other articles on eye diseases and medical social issues. He also edited and contributed to two works, "War or Culture? I and II" published in 1929 and 1936, respectively.
